Address: 98, HAL Old Airport Rd, Kodihalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560017
Review:
My father had to undergo an emergency nose surgery. He was bleeding very frequently from the nose. Dr. V T Anand performed the surgery. He explained it to us in detail about the problem and what is the procedure that he will do. He was patient to answer all the questions. 

All the staff members were co-operative and were there to help when needed. The operation theater staff including Ms. Merlin kept updated about the status of surgery. This all helped in keeping the overall anxiety level low.

On the last day, when we were to be discharged, we found a 'housefly' in the food that was given to my father. We found it after he had consumed more than half of his lunch. :( 
You generally don't expect such things in hospital food for patients and eat it with complete faith. I didn't want to escalate the issue, since everything else had been smooth for us so just reported it without making noise about it. But I also want the kitchen to take the corrective measures and ensure that this doesn't happen again, hence posting it here.

Address: 8th Main Road, 5/2, 13th Cross Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
Review:
I am a working professional at a digital company, did want to share my experience about visiting Manipal Hospital for regular health check up and It came to my surprise that the faculty at the hospital are not only money drivers but irresponsible too. 

I booked an appointment at 4 PM the previous evening and cancelled the day's plan to allot all my day for the health check up. Travelling is main concern to this place as it is located at one of the prime place in Bangalore. 

The next morning, I set myself up not eating much and keeping my body in tone for check up and I receive a call from them by noon. And here they say, " your appointment is cancelled, come tomorrow" without any intimation. This has caused inconvenience for the third time in three weeks consequently. 

People with hope are discouraged at Manipal Hospital as the rude behaviour of the faculty has caused lot of inconvenience so to speak. 
Shame on a health care that has no value for money, time and people. I have visited several times before for my mother's recovery but not once have i found the ambience and support to revive with good health. I suggest the higher foundation grounds to look into better the hospital atmosphere. Highly disappointed with the Manipal Hospital Service. Will never recommend anyone to visit.

Review: Good Hospital for the urology related problems very good infrastructure of the malleshwaram is the most good physician are also available very good health care instruments are available,nice pharmaceutical facilities are available .canteen facilities is available at door entrance of the hospital.good experience at hospital wheelchair accessible in the door and easily visible from normal traffic it available for the OPD really good service with pleasure.confortable staff and doctors.

Address: 8th Main Road, 5/2, 13th Cross Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
Review: Never go to this hospital for helth checks..up to 4pm you will not get reports. And hospital refused to give reports in my hand unless doctor appointment is completed. They never give attention what you are telling. Even after repeated requests to give my reports they told me will not give you must see doctor. I suggest not to go this hospital for medical tests. Worst experience

Address: 8th Main Road, 5/2, 13th Cross Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003

Hospital cleaning was very good. Since I found it very good during my first visit so, I visited again there even I was staying too far from the hospital.

Address: 8th Main Road, 5/2, 13th Cross Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
Review: We visited the hospital for dental consultation, root canal, capping and extraction. The dentist is very kind and explains the procedures in detail. Address: 8th Main Road, 5/2, 13th Cross Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
Review: Definitely 5 star from my side – my experience and observation from 9 AM to  3 PM is the hospital is filled with courteous staff,  they are very organised and excellent co-ordination between the staffs had helped me get through the various tests and doc visits without any hurdle or chasing them. Staffs of each department have been very hospitable. All the facilities were very neatly maintained. Doctors explained my health status and were kind enough to answer my queries. Overall a very good experience and would recommend others in my circle to consider Manipal Northside for any health checkup.

Address: No. 71, 11th Main Rd, Opp Railway Station, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
Review:
Hi,
Greetings!
Our experience has been very good. My father was in ICU for a month. The Public Relation Officer Ms.Indrani is fabulous. She helped us with all informations, provided the requisite facilities such as ambulance, information on services and methodologies to ease my dad's stay at Manipal Northside hospital.

At ICU all doctors and nurses took care of my father. I am able to hv my father by my side only because of doctors Dr.Dinesh Kamath, Dr.Shankarappa (fabulous), Dr. Arun Raykar, Dr. Nagesh, Dr.Basavaraj, Dr. Hemanth, duty doctors Dr.Santhosh, Dr. Geetha, Dr.Pavithra, Dr. Sachin, Nurses like Ms.Tancy.

At Administration Mr.Pramod, Ms. Ananthlakshmi, Mr. Raju; at ambulance both the drivers were very helpful. The housekeeping helped us all through.

All in all the hospital is very good. Only one need to hv patience. I hv seen my father's neighbour who had brain injury recovering so amazingly. Cost is certainly very high, but recovery is almost certain unless the patient is unable to cope. 

It is my suggestion that hospital authorities may find some way to bring cost down for lower middle class families then perhaps nobody can be better than "Manipal Northside Hospital".

Thank you all of you Manipal staff.

Regards
Prof.Dr.Ar.Chandran Rekha Jetty

Address: No. 71, 11th Main Rd, Opp Railway Station, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
Review:
The hospital was good when it was Northside and later Northside Manipal Hospital.  I was going here for almost 15 years but now I have stopped.  Now it is no longer good after it became Manipal Malleswaram.   Why?

1) All experienced Doctors who were here have all moved to other places like Apollo, Jain etc.

2) The OPD and Hospital - in 2 different places. Lot of issues for people as well as Doctors.

3) The hospital is simply focused on profits and not welfare of the people

4) I admitted my mother for 1 day . They just tried doing an aspiration procedure and could not even complete. For that they charged a bomb though they did nothing actually  (I knew how much it will cost for the same procedure as I had got it done earlier in another hospital as my mother was in another place when the illness was diagnosed - so I came to know).  I stopped going there though it was very near to my house in Malleswaram and started going to Ramaiah Hospitals  which was much better.  Manipal did not even give Discharge Summary. I followed for 2 weeks and left it as it was disgusting

5) The inexperienced doctors here even call you on your mobile, asking  you to go for some procedure (which we had decided against after Multiple Experts Opinion in the Field) just to get you admitted and make money. Can you believe, the Doctor even calls you and canvasses you to go for the procedure - like a Sales rep of Eureka Forbes Vacuum Cleaner

IN A NUTSHELL

INEXPERIENCED DOCTORS
SIMPLY MONEY MINDED AND PROFIT ORIENTED THAN WELFARE

Address: 143, 212-2015 KR Puram Hobli, Off Hoodi Village, EPIP, Industrial Area, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560066
Review:
After having few worst experiences in the past in other hospitals, we  visited Manipal Whitefield hospital for a minor surgery, we are surprised to see how it went here this time.

Admission:
Needs improvement as they send you to few places to check the estimates and insurance feasibilities. Which can definitely be improved by placing such help desks close so that we don't have to run around.

Other than that it was just amazing service at the admission desk

Room:
We took Delux room and it was no where less than a 5 star hotel experience. We wondered to see the cleanliness in this hospital. The rooms are spacious. Beautiful view from the windows. Great maintenance. Latest facilities available 5 stars for this. Check the photos to see the room.

Doctors:
Just blindly trust them. They are polite and down to the Earth. They listen to you very well. After seeing few operations today I felt these doctors are really living Gods.  5 starts again as I don't have anything after 5

Attendees and facilities:

5 starts. They are the best to make you feel better. These guys are so polite and well behaved.

Nursing :
No words to describe their duty. Every single thing is done on time and with must care. They take care of medication and food for you. They order what you should eat and at the very right time for you.

We met Greeshma and few other nursing staff (few names I don't remember. Really sorry about that ) they all show you such a great hospitality here. Greeshma said once the patient is here, we treat them like our guests 

Kavipriya was the best in making sure we had a good experience with nursing staff facilities and also to have a smooth insurance clearance and discharge. Thanks a ton for her too

Food:
The best. Patient gets a different food which should be the case all the time and attendees get different one. Had an awesome experience here too. Easy to order and delivered quick

Discharge:
I felt they are low in staff as so many people were waiting. Queuing is not properly handled here. That definitely needs improvement. A token system could help a lot.

Even though billing staff was too busy, I felt they did the best to make things faster.

Overall a great experience. Thanks a lot for world-class experience. You set the standards for others.

Thanks
Praveen
